introduction: This guide provides comprehensive information for Nepali students aspiring to study in Australia on a Student Visa (Subclass 500). It covers all aspects of the application process, from eligibility and requirements to post-arrival practicalities.  Information is current as of October 26, 2023, but always refer to official sources for the most up-to-date details.

visa_types_and_eligibility.question: What types of student visas are available for Nepali students?
visa_types_and_eligibility.answer: The main student visa for Nepali citizens is the Student Visa (Subclass 500). This visa allows you to study full-time in a registered course in Australia. Eligibility criteria include a genuine temporary entrant (GTE) requirement, demonstrating your intention to stay in Australia temporarily for study purposes.

application_procedures.question: What is the application process for the Student Visa (Subclass 500)?
application_procedures.answer: The application process is online through ImmiAccount. You will need to create an account, complete the application form, and upload all required documents.  Ensure you provide accurate information and meet all deadlines. See specific document requirements in subsequent sections.

financial_requirements.question: What are the financial requirements for Nepali students?
financial_requirements.answer: You must demonstrate sufficient funds to cover your tuition fees, living expenses, and travel costs.  Evidence can include bank statements, loan approval letters, or scholarship letters. The required amount varies depending on your course and duration of stay, so check the Department of Home Affairs website for current details.
financial_requirements.example: For instance, if your tuition is AUD 20,000 per year and living expenses are estimated at AUD 21,200, you'll need to show proof of approximately AUD 41,200 for one year.  (AUD 1 ≈ NPR 85 as of October 26, 2023 - check current exchange rates).

introduction: This checklist outlines the essential documents Nepali students need to prepare for their Australian Student Visa (Subclass 500) application.  Always consult the official Department of Home Affairs website for the most current requirements.

document_checklist.details: Your passport must be valid for the duration of your intended stay in Australia.
Issued by your Australian education provider, this confirms your acceptance into a registered course.

Provide certified copies of your previous educational qualifications, including SLC, +2, and Bachelor's degree certificates (if applicable).  Ward verification of your academic documents might be required.
document_checklist.ward_verification: In Nepal, ward verification involves getting your academic documents verified by your local ward office. This is an important step for document authentication.

document_checklist.document: English Language Proficiency Test Results (IELTS, TOEFL, PTE, etc.)
document_checklist.details: Demonstrate your English language proficiency by providing scores from an accepted test.  Specific score requirements vary depending on your course.
document_checklist.example: For example, many universities require an overall IELTS score of 6.5 with no band less than 6.0.

document_checklist.details: A personal statement explaining your genuine intention to stay in Australia temporarily for study purposes.  Address your ties to Nepal, your study plans, and your reasons for choosing Australia.
document_checklist.tip: Be honest and specific in your GTE statement.  Provide evidence of your ties to Nepal, such as family relationships, property ownership, or future career plans.

document_checklist.details: Provide evidence of sufficient funds to cover your tuition, living expenses, and travel costs.  This can include bank statements, loan approval letters, or scholarship letters.  See FAQ 1 for financial requirement details.

document_checklist.document: Health Insurance (Overseas Student Health Cover - OSHC)
document_checklist.details: You must have OSHC for the duration of your visa.  Purchase this from an approved Australian provider.
Recent passport-sized photographs that meet Australian visa photo specifications.

title: Study in Australia: FAQs for Nepali Students
content:
**Q: What are the popular study fields in Australia?**
A: Business, engineering, humanities, and language studies. [1]

**Q: How many Australian cities are in the QS Best Student Cities 2025 top 50?**
A: Six. [1]

**Q: How long are post-study work rights in Australia?**
A: Up to 6 years. [1]

**Q: How many Australian universities are in the QS World University Rankings 2025 top 100?**
A: Nine. [1]

**Q: What is the maximum allowed part-time work hours for students in Australia?**
A: 48 hours per fortnight. [5]

**Q: What is UNSW's global ranking (QS World University Rankings)?**
A: #20 (2024-2026). [5]

**Q: How many UNSW subjects are ranked in the top 20 globally (QS World University Rankings by Subject, 2025)?**
A: Four. [5]

**Q: How is UNSW ranked in Australia for employment outcomes (QS World University Rankings, 2026)?**
A: #1. [5]

citations.quote: Australia remains a top destination for Nepalese students seeking high-quality education, offering diverse courses across fields like business, engineering, humanities, and language studies. With over 22,000 programs at 1,100 universities and institutions, students can earn globally recognised degrees... According to the QS Best Student Cities 2025, 6 of the top 50 student cities are in Australia.* Post-study work rights: Australia offer up to 6 years of post-study work rights World-recognised universities: Australia is known for its good quality education. According to the QS World University Rankings 2025, 9 of the top 100 universities are in Australia.* ... Part-time Work: You can work part-time up to 48 hours per fortnight in Australia

Ranked #20 globally in the QS World University Rankings, 2024–2026 Four subjects ranked in the top 20, QS World University Rankings by Subject, 2025 Ranked #1 in Australia for employment outcomes, QS World University Rankings, 2026 ... Take a quick look into UNSW in our quick guide, or explore our world-class degrees, entry requirements, student support and much more within undergraduate and postgraduate student guides - register now to download our international student guides. ... Offers to UNSW are based on academic merit.
